Responsibilities: Deliver high-quality, evidence-based primary care services.
Manage acute and chronic conditions, preventive health, and wellness screenings.
Coordinate patient care with specialists and support services.
Maintain timely and accurate documentation in the EMR.
Participate in team-based quality improvement initiatives.
Requirements: MD or DO degree from an accredited medical school.
Board-certified or board-eligible in Family Medicine or Internal Medicine.
Active or eligible medical license in the District of Columbia.
Commitment to serving medically underserved populations.
Benefits: Comprehensive health, dental, and vision coverage.
Generous paid time off and CME allowance.
Be part of a mission-driven organization making a lasting impact on public health in the D.C. community
Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team committed to holistic, patient-centered care
Access opportunities for continued professional growth and development
Enjoy competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package
